definitions.definition: To apply a force to (an object) such that it moves away from the person or thing applying the force.
definitions.example: In his anger he pushed me against the wall and threatened me.

definitions.definition: To continually attempt to persuade (a person) into a particular course of action.
To press or urge forward; to drive.
definitions.example: to push an objection too far; to push one's luck

definitions.definition: To continually promote (a point of view, a product for sale, etc.).
definitions.example: Stop pushing the issue — I'm not interested.

definitions.definition: To continually exert oneself in order to achieve a goal.
To approach; to come close to.
definitions.example: He's pushing sixty. (= he's nearly sixty years old)

definitions.definition: To tense the muscles in the abdomen in order to expel its contents.
definitions.example: During childbirth, there are times when the obstetrician advises the woman not to push.

definitions.definition: To continue to attempt to persuade a person into a particular course of action.
To make a higher bid at an auction.
To add (a data item) to the top of a stack.
To publish (an update, etc.) by transmitting it to other computers.
To thrust the points of the horns against; to gore.
To burst out of its pot, as a bud or shoot.
To strike the cue ball in such a way that it stays in contact with the cue and object ball at the same time (a foul shot).
The act by which something is pushed.
definitions.example: We were soon separated by the pushings and shovings of the crowd.
